member.summary: Cache item should never expire.

member.name: T:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemPriority
member.summary: Specifies the relative priority of items stored in the cache.

member.name: F:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemPriority.Low
member.summary: Cache items with this priority level are the most likely to be deleted from the cache as the server frees system memory.

member.name: F:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemPriority.Normal
member.summary: Cache items with this priority level are likely to be deleted from the cache as the server frees system memory.

member.name: F:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemPriority.High
member.summary: Cache items with this priority level are the least likely to be deleted from the cache as the server frees system memory.

member.name: F:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemPriority.NotRemovable
member.summary: The cache items with this priority level will not be automatically deleted from the cache as the server frees system memory.

member.summary: Defines a callback method for notifying applications when a cached item is removed from the cache.
member.param: The key that is removed from the cache.
The item associated with the key removed from the cache.
The reason the item was removed from the cache.

member.name: T:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemRemovedReason
member.summary: Specifies the reason an item was removed from the cache.

member.name: F:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemRemovedReason.Removed
member.summary: The item is removed from the cache because of method remove or replace.

member.name: F:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemRemovedReason.Expired
member.summary: The item is removed from the cache because it expired.

member.name: F:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemRemovedReason.Underused
member.summary: The item is removed from the cache because the system removed it to free memory.

member.name: F:CMS.Helpers.CMSCacheItemRemovedReason.DependencyChanged
member.summary: The item is removed from the cache because the cache dependency associated with it changed.

member.summary: Represents a cache with reading, inserting and removing support.

member.summary: Inserts an object into the cache.
member.param: The cache key used to reference the object.
The object to be inserted in the cache.
The file or cache key dependencies for the item. When any dependency changes, the object becomes invalid and is removed from the cache.
The time at which the inserted object expires and is removed from the cache.
The interval between the time the inserted object was last accessed and the time at which that object expires.
The cost of the object relative to other items stored in the cache.
A delegate that, if provided, will be called when an object is removed from the cache.

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.CacheHelper.Cache``1(System.Func{CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings,``0},CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings)
member.summary: Wraps the operation to a cached section. This method supports progressive caching and is able to distribute unhandled exceptions to other simultaneously running threads.
member.remarks: can be used to avoid a dependency on this static method.

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.CacheHelper.CacheAsync``1(System.Func{CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}},CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings)
member.summary: Asynchronously loads data. If multiple threads are loading the same data, only one thread executes the load, stores the result into cache and the result is distributed to other waiting threads. If an exception is thrown during execution, the exception is distributed as well. No data are cached in such a case.
member.typeparam: Type of data to be loaded.
member.param: Function accepting cache settings and returning the asynchronous data loading task.
member.returns: Returns a task returning the loaded data.
member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when multiple threads are loading the same item (identified by ) with incompatible .

remarks.para: Based on the the data is stored into cache. If is set to false, no caching is performed and fresh data are retrieved.

If both progressive load is allowed (both and are set to true), the fresh data retrieval is subject to progressive load (i.e. only one threads executes the load and the result is distributed to other waiting threads). Otherwise, the is always executed.
No assumptions must be made on which thread executes the . The thread creating the underlying load item is not necessarily the one executing the item. Any of the waiting threads can execute the item.
can be used to avoid a dependency on this static method.

member.typeparam: Type of data to be loaded.
member.param: Function accepting cache settings and a cancellation token and returning the asynchronous data loading task.
member.returns: Returns a task returning the loaded data.
member.exception: Thrown when or is null.

member.remarks: In a web site environment () on the .NET Framework platform the underlying cache is the HTTP runtime cache, which does not support compacting.

member.summary: Indicates whether sliding expiration should be used. If enabled, objects are removed from the cache only if they are not accessed for the number of minutes specified by .

member.name: P:CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings.CacheDependency
member.summary: Cache dependency to use for the cache item. When GetCacheDependency is set and this property is not set explicitly, the value is retrieved by calling the delegate in GetCacheDependency property. Use setter of this property only in the data loading code of the cached code block to avoid unnecessary initialization of the dependencies. Use delegate property GetCacheDependency to provide cache dependencies in a more efficient way only when the system really needs them.

member.name: T:CMS.Helpers.IProgressiveCache
member.summary: Provides optimization of parallel data loads. The data are loaded once, stored into cache and the result is shared.
member.remarks: Use dependency on this interface rather than depending on static members of the class (e.g. , or ).

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.IProgressiveCache.Load``1(System.Func{CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings,``0},CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings)
member.summary: Loads data. If multiple threads are loading the same data, only one thread executes the load, stores the result into cache and the result is distributed to other waiting threads. If an exception is thrown during execution, the exception is distributed as well. No data are cached in such a case.
member.typeparam: Type of data to be loaded.
member.param: Function accepting cache settings and returning the data.
member.exception: Thrown when or is null.

remarks.para: Based on the the data is stored into cache. If is set to false, no caching is performed and fresh data are retrieved.

If both progressive load is allowed (both and are set to true), the fresh data retrieval is subject to progressive load (i.e. only one threads executes the load and the result is distributed to other waiting threads). Otherwise, the is always executed.
The internals of the method are based on .

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.IProgressiveCache.LoadAsync``1(System.Func{CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}},CMS.Helpers.CacheSettings)
member.summary: Asynchronously loads data. If multiple threads are loading the same data, only one thread executes the load, stores the result into cache and the result is distributed to other waiting threads. If an exception is thrown during execution, the exception is distributed as well. No data are cached in such a case.
member.typeparam: Type of data to be loaded.
member.param: Function accepting cache settings and returning the asynchronous data loading task.
member.returns: Returns a task returning the loaded data.
member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when multiple threads are loading the same item (identified by ) with incompatible .

remarks.para: Based on the the data is stored into cache. If is set to false, no caching is performed and fresh data are retrieved.

If both progressive load is allowed (both and are set to true), the fresh data retrieval is subject to progressive load (i.e. only one threads executes the load and the result is distributed to other waiting threads). Otherwise, the is always executed.
No assumptions must be made on which thread executes the . The thread creating the underlying load item is not necessarily the one executing the item. Any of the waiting threads can execute the item.

member.name: T:CMS.Helpers.IProgressiveLoader
member.summary: Provides optimization of parallel data loads. The data are loaded once and the result is shared.

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.IProgressiveLoader.LoadAsync``1(System.String,System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}})
member.summary: Asynchronously loads data. If multiple threads are loading the same data, only one thread executes the load and the result is distributed to other waiting threads. If an exception is thrown during execution, the exception is distributed as well.
member.typeparam: Type of data to be loaded.
member.param: Function returning the asynchronous data loading task.
member.returns: Returns a task returning the loaded data.
member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when multiple threads are loading the same item (identified by ) with incompatible .

remarks.para: The progressive loader is not a persistent cache. Once the data is loaded and the result is distributed to all waiting threads, the data is freed from the memory. Use the method to avoid parallel load of the same data while still loading the latest version of the data for consecutive loads.

No assumptions must be made on which thread executes the . The thread creating the underlying progressive load item is not necessarily the one executing the item. Any of the waiting threads can execute the item.

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.IProgressiveLoader.LoadAsync``1(System.String,System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously loads data. If multiple threads are loading the same data, only one thread executes the load and the result is distributed to other waiting threads. If an exception is thrown during execution, the exception is distributed as well.
member.typeparam: Type of data to be loaded.
member.param: Function accepting a cancellation token and returning the asynchronous data loading task.
member.returns: Returns a task returning the loaded data.
member.exception: Thrown when or is null.

member.summary: Provides methods for obtaining and manipulation with the cookie level for the current request.

member.summary: Cookie level from site settings.

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.CurrentCookieLevelProvider.GetCurrentCookieLevel
member.summary: Gets the cookie level of the current request.

remarks.para: If the cookie level is not set yet, the application setting "CMSDefaultCookieLevel" specified in the settings is used.
When calling this method, response cookie is set.
Inbuilt cookie level values are represented by the constants in the class.

member.returns: Returns the cookie level of the current request.

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.CurrentCookieLevelProvider.SetCurrentCookieLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the cookie level to the specified level.
member.remarks: This action clears all the cookies that have a cookie level set lower that the new cookie level. New cookie level value is stored into the response cookie .
member.param: Cookie level to be set. Predefined constants in the class can be used.

member.summary: Returns version based on rendering engine rather then on version declared by the browser itself for supported browsers. If browser or its rendering engine version is not supported, null is returned.
member.param: Browser string that was sent by the browser in the User-Agent request header.
Complete user-agent string of the client.

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.BrowserHelper.GetInternetExplorerVersionFromRendererVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Gets version of Internet explorer from the rendering engine version. According to the server configuration, when browsing intranet sites Internet explorer automatically switches to the compatible mode, which is in general lower version of the browser. This is suitable for rendering but not for analytics, therefore real version has to be obtained based on the string specifying version of the Trident rendering engine. Version cannot be obtained using .NET browser capabilities object.
member.remarks: More information can be found on MSDN: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms537503(v=vs.85).aspx.
member.param: Browser user agent, that will be used for obtaining version of Trident rendering engine
member.returns: Version obtained from given . If no version can be determined, returns null.

If multiple instances operate within the same directory, the behavior is undefined.

member.summary: Gets prefix used for unique identification of storage item locks.

member.name: M:CMS.Helpers.PersistentStorageManager.GetItemFromStorage(System.String,System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Action{System.Object},System.Func{System.Object})
member.summary: Gets the specified item from the persistent storage. The value is loaded from the storage only if is met. Otherwise the result of is returned. The evaluation of condition and execution of either load action or return function are performed atomically.
member.param: Condition evaluated atomically before the storage read operation. If the condition is evaluated to true (or is not provided), the read operation and are performed.
Action executed atomically when the is met. The value read from the storage is passed as the action argument. If the storage item does not exist, null value is passed as the action argument.
Function whose result is returned when is not met. If it is not provided, it is treated as if it returned null.
member.returns: Item value loaded from the storage if the is met and the storage item exists. Result of when the is not met (if return function is not provided, it is treated as if it returns null). Null if is met, but the storage item does not exist.

member.summary: Saves the item to the persistent storage.
member.param: Action executed atomically with the storage write operation.

member.summary: Deletes the specified item from the persistent storage. If the storage item does not exist, no action is performed.
member.param: Action executed atomically with the storage delete operation.

member.summary: Deletes storage items which are expired.

member.summary: Deletes a storage item if it is expired. The check whether item is expired an its removal are performed atomically.
member.param: Name of the file within persistent storage (with extension).
Action executed atomically with the delete operation of expired item. The deleted item key is passed as the action argument.

members.member:
If amount is equal to 1, expression using singular formatting string is returned, otherwise expression using plural formatting string is returned.
Amount to be used Singular formatting string. If formatting item {0} is not included, it is formatted as '[amount] [singular]', e.g.: 1 unit /// Plural formatting string. If formatting item {0} is not included, it is formatted as '[amount] [plural]', e.g.: 3 units
